channel.title: Georgetown forum
channel.description:
Moderated by Wallace Fanning, this series presents a panel of guests discussing a variety of topics. The radio series launched in 1946. It also later aired on WTTG-TV in Washington, D.C. These programs aired 1968-69.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Future scientists and their teachers
item.description: This program features Dr. Phoebe Knippling, Arlington County, VA, public schools; Maurice Leikund, fellow, Washington Academy of Scientists; and Grover Sherlin, National Bureau of Standards.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: World money outlook
item.description: This program features Pierre Paul Schweitzer, International Monetary Fund; Charles A. Serrone, Kiplinger Publications; and L.A. Jennings, chief executive officer and chairman of the board, Riggs National Bank.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: RMP: Master plan for medicine
item.description: This program features medical doctors, Dr. William S. McKuen; Dr. John C. Rose; and Dr. Arthur E. Wentz discussing risk management plans.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: The law, the individual
item.description: This program features a discussion with Georgetown University students Barry Portence of Texas, Willie Cook of Washington, D.C., Barbara Cohen of New Jersey, and John Argiola of New York.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Drug addiction and crime
item.description: This program features a discussion with Dr. Alan Z. Schwarzberg, Georgetown University; Dr. David Lanham, George Washington University; and Dr. James L. Foy, Georgetown University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Atlantic community
item.description: Donald Panzera, Georgetown University senior; Sepp Buehler, University of Vienna; and Dr. Paul Ellow, Georgetown University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Students on U.S. foreign policy
item.description: This program features William A. Bell, Jr., foreign service officer and member of State Department Open Forum Panel; and three students from Georgetown University School of Foreign Service: Dean Krum, Deidre Kelly, and Steven Craven.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Latin America: Student dissent
item.description: This program features Dr. Thomas Dodd, Georgetown University; Dr. Harold E. Davis, American University; and Armando Mon, American University graduate student.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Peace Corps: New diplomacy
item.description: This program features Reverend George H. Dunn, World Council of Churches; John Curtis, deputy director of public affairs, Peace Corps; Michael Bowden, director, Georgetown University Community Action Program, former Peace Corps volunteer.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Russian Revolution at sea
item.description: This program features Girard C. Smith, former Assistant Secretary of State and director of policy planning staff of the State Department; Dr. Thomas W. Wolfe, senior staff member, RAND Corp.; L. Edgar Prina, Copley News Service.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Soviet Jews' plight
item.description: This program features Dr. Isaac Franck, executive vice president, Jewish Community Council of Greater Washington; Leon Volkoff, Newsweek; Roland R. Higstaff, editor, Liberty Magazine, a Seventh Day Adventist publication.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: As others see us
item.description: This program features Reverend Gerard F. Yates, director of international student programs, Georgetown University; and three Georgetown graduate students from Guinea, Brazil, and Greece.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: The poor and food marketing
item.description: This program presents Dale L. Anderson, foor marketing analyst for U.S. Department of Agriculture; Dr. Wilford L. White, Howard University; George L. Small, food wholesaler from York, Pa.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Juvenile crime and elder generation
item.description: This program features a discussion with Patricia Rukle, dean of women, Georgetown University; Professor George R. Houston, Jr., Georgetown University; and Professor Eugene K. Snyder, Georgetown University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Latin America nationalism
item.description: This program features Dr. Francisco V. Corsiamidore, Organization of American States; Dr. Joseph L. Tryon, Georgetown University; and Dr. Siegfried Corboni, Georgetown University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: European reporters on U.S.
item.description: This program features Steven Barber, chief correspondent, London Daily Telegraph; Jean Legranges, national manager, Agence-France Press; and Wolfgang Nolte, Washington bureau chief, Deutsche Presse Agentur.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: U.S. foreign investments
item.description: This program features Dr. David C. Mulford, White Weld and Company; Robert O. Sayler, Georgetown University senior; Christian Hoffman, Georgetown University senior; and George Eureka, Investment Bankers Association of America.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: The scientist and ethics
item.description: This program features a discussion with Rev. Frances J. Heiden, Georgetown University; Dr. Lawrence S. Williamfield, Georgetown University; and Dr. Raymond Seger, National Science Foundation.

item.title: Student initiative: Free university
item.description: This program features W. Patrick Goen, dean of freshmen, Georgetown University; Reese Fullerton, senior; Scott Riordan, junior; James Heathcox, junior; all Georgetown students

item.title: Disturbed children: Institution or home?
item.description: This program feature a discussion with Robert E. Costello, Christchild Institute for Children; Dr. William B. Klotworthy, Christchild Institute for Children; and Dr. Edmund S. Kissler, Georgetown University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Kidneys, lives, dollars
item.description: This program features Dr. George E. Shriner, president, National Kidney Foundation; Charles Plant, consultant to National Kidney Foundation; Kidney transplant recipients Rudolfo Debercelli and Arthur Mauk.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Latin America: New left
item.description: This program features Dr. Luis E. Aguilar, Georgetown University, author of "Marxism in Latin America"; and Dr. Brady Tyson, American University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.description: This program features a discussion with Dr. Thomas Dodd, Georgetown University; and Dr. Norman A. Bailey, City University of New York.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Federal funds to militants
item.description: This program features T. John Own; Robert A. Tonz; Jeff Storey; and Dallas Perkins. All are members of Georgetown University's College of Arts and Sciences, and debating society.

item.title: Latin America: Military's role
item.description: This program features James W. Rose, Brookings Institution; Dr. Luis E. Aguilar, Georgetown University; and Dr. William H. Brill, Georgetown University.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Cancer research breakthrough
item.description: This program features Mark Eastmolsen, Georgetown University; Ernest J. Dupreau, University of Maryland School of Medicine; and Lasalle D. Lafaux, Jr., Howard University. School of Medicine.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: A bench view of crime
item.description: This program features a discussion with Edward M. Curran, Chief Judge, United States District Courts for District of Columbia; and Joseph M.F. Ryan, Jr., Judge of District of Columbia Court of General Sessions.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Developing the diplomat
item.description: This program features George V. Allen, former United States ambassador to several nations and former director of Foreign Service Institute of State Deptartment; Dr. Jesse A. Mann, Georgetown University; and Dr. Richard Butwell, American University.
item.dc:creator: Georgetown University
item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions

item.title: Writers' conference
item.description: This program features a discussion with Dr. Wiley Hughes, founder and director of Georgetown University Writers Conference; Patricia McGurren, novelist; Marjorie Holmes, writer and columnist; and Dr. Roland Flint, Georgetown University.

item.dc:subject: Radio panel discussions
